alert.note: Alert for Kauai North; Maui Central Valley North; Maui Windward West; Molokai North; Molokai West; Molokai Windward; Niihau; Oahu North Shore; Waianae Coast; Windward Haleakala (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Warning issued January 21 at 4:15AM HST until January 23 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT THROUGH EARLY MONDAY MORNING FOR THE NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI AND FOR THE NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI... .An extra large northwest (310 degree) swell will arrive late tonight that will produce extremely dangerous surf and overwash conditions along many north and west facing shorelines. ...HIGH SURF WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 6 AM HST MONDAY... * WHAT...Dangerous large breaking waves of between 35 to 45 feet along the north facing shores of Niihau Kauai Oahu Molokai and Maui...20 to 30 feet along the west facing shores of Niihau Kauai Oahu and Molokai. * WHERE...North and west facing shores of Niihau, Kauai, Oahu, Molokai, and north facing shores of Maui. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 6 AM HST Monday. * IMPACTS...Very High. Expect ocean water surging and sweeping across beaches, periodically overtopping vulnerable coastal roadways with localized beach erosion. Wave runup could impact coastal properties and infrastructure, especially around high tides early Sunday morning. Powerful longshore and rip currents will be present. Surges and strong currents inside exposed harbors could cause damage to boats due to the jostling of boats and floating docks.
info.instruction: Stay away from the shoreline along the affected coasts. Be prepared for road closures. Postpone entering or leaving channels affected by the high surf until the surf subsides.
